# Available containers

Our ultimate goal is to have containers that match all [primary CRAN Linux
systems](https://cran.r-project.org/web/checks/check_flavors.html) and all
[extra CRAN checks](https://cran.r-project.org/web/checks/check_issue_kinds.html).

Currently we have the following CRAN-like containers:

| CRAN name                         | R-hub name   | Details                                 |
|:----------------------------------|:-------------|:----------------------------------------|
| r-devel-linux-x86_64-debian-clang | ubuntu-clang | [Details](containers.html#ubuntu-clang) |
| r-devel-linux-x86_64-debian-gcc   | ubuntu-gcc12 | [Details](containers.html#ubuntu-gcc12) |

Plus the following containers for additional CRAN checks:

| CRAN name  | R-hub name | Description                                                      | Details                                |
|:-----------|:-----------|:-----------------------------------------------------------------|:---------------------------------------|
|ATLAS       | atlas      | Tests with alternative BLAS/LAPACK implementations               | [Details](containers.html#atlas)       |
|clang-ASAN  | clang-asan | Tests of memory access errors using AddressSanitizer             | [Details](containers.html#clang-asan)  |
|clang-UBSAN | clang-asan | Tests of memory access errors using Undefined Behavior Sanitizer | [Details](containers.html#clang-asan)  |
|clang16     | clang16    | Checks with Clang 16.0.0                                         | [Details](containers.html#clang16)     |
|gcc13       | gcc13      | Checks with GCC trunk aka 13.0                                   | [Details](containers.html#gcc13)       |
|noLD        | nold       | Tests without long double                                        | [Details](containers.html#nold)        |

Additional containers

| Description                                                      | Details                                |
|:-----------------------------------------------------------------|:---------------------------------------|
| Test R on CentOS 7 (equivalent to RHEL 7), w/ multiple R versions| [Details](containers.html#centos7)     |

All containers are available from
[Docker Hub](https://hub.docker.com/u/rhub) and from
[Github Packages](https://github.com/orgs/r-hub/packages?repo_name=containers).

See the [containers page](containers.html) for more data about the
containers.

# Usage

You can use these containers [on your machine](local.html), or on
[GitHub Actions](gha.html).
